entry.et: Middle English lim, from Old English; akin to Old Norse limr limb and perhaps to Old English lith limb

def.dt: :one of the projecting paired appendages (as wings) of an animal body used especially for movement and grasping but sometimes modified into sensory or sexual organs
:a leg or arm of a human being
:a large primary branch of a tree
:in an exposed or dangerous position with little chance of retreat
:to cut off the limbs of (a felled tree)
:the outer edge of the apparent disk of a celestial body
:the expanded portion of an organ or structure
:the upper spreading portion of a corolla (as of the phlox) whose lower part consists of a tube of fused petals
:an often painful sensation of the presence of a limb that has been amputated called also phantom pain
